column1: Skype	1	2020-04-23T11:44:40+00:00	My Skype account was hacked. (I since learned there is a way to do that and I dont want to give too much information as to how that was done. It was very obvious as to what they did when I looked at my account.) Through the auto recharge set up with my PayPal and then with my bank account the hackers managed to take hundreds of euro from me. They ran through my Skype credit and straight into the auto recharge which is linked with my PayPal account. Multiple repeat takings emptied my PayPal balance inside a minute. Then in a domino effect they used the same method with the auto recharge function to get into my bank account. By the time more than 400 euro was taken my banks fraud detection shut it down. In the end the hackers cleaned me out of more than 600 euro. My Bank paid me back as did PayPal. The scam and hack is/was very obvious. Could not be calls as autorecharge went through consequetively within seconds running into hundreds of euro. Skype did not and have not been co operative at all with this. Disgusted with Skype and strongly recommend everyone to not have auto recharge set up with Skype. You are open to the same hacking and scam I was and your bank may not be as supportive as mine was. Skype certainly wont be.

column1: Skype	1	2017-08-26T21:49:55Z	"When MSN Messenger was no longer an option
column2: Skype was the best alternative. Since that point
column3: the company really have become far too full of themselves. Bugs are plenty and updates to fix them are few. There are far more issues to condemn Skype than there are to praise it.

column1: Here are some frequent issues:
1. Pending / Undelivered Text
You can be typing away without issue when suddenly your messages are met with a spinning circle pending connection. At this moment
column2: it's common to check if your internet is experiencing issues or perhaps the fault is with your partner (Whomever you're typing to). Commonly
column3: I will send a message to someone else at this point to discover if the fault is on my end or on the other users end. Most
column4: if not all times
column5: I am met with the same issue
column6: that messages sent to anyone from me are pending.

column1: I then decide to check my browser and load up websites or videos to ensure I am receiving a connection. The connection is fine
column2: everything else works as intended apart from Skype. This typically lasts anywhere from 1 minute to 5 before the messages will all suddenly send at once.

column1: 2. Accidental Calls
If you accidentally hit the keys Ctrl+Q
column2: you have hit the short keys to initiate a call within Skype.

column1: Typically
column2: this happens when the user has accidentally hit Ctrl rather than Shift. Now
column3: if you call someone and did not mean to
column4: the easiest thing to do is press the cancel call button before the other person answers. However
column5: after having tested this specifically 10 times in a row
column6: both my skype program and the other users skype that receives the call
column7: crashes and stops responding.

column1: I tested this multiple times and without fail
column2: every single test
column3: it had the same result of both participants skype not responding.

column1: 3. Skype on Mobile
Skype on mobile is simply not a viable option whatsoever. Regardless of how powerful the hardware your phone sports
column2: Skype will inevitably hit a stand-still and is required to be shut down and reloaded. It starts out fine
column3: being able to type at any speed you're capable of. However
column4: as typing goes on
column5: the keyboard begins to lag and suddenly you're having to slow yourself down to pressing individual letters slowly and steadily while the on-screen keyboard has a chance to catch up.

column1: At this point
column2: to prevent it getting worse
column3: you are required to close the app and re-open to refresh. This happens without fail on a regular basis.

column1: Conclusion:
Skype has many issues that require immediate attention
column2: yet regardless of how many complaints are put online and how many issues are voted highly in the realms of needing fixed
column3: Skype falls silent. We have updates that change the appearance and interface of Skype
column4: giving it a new look and feel
column5: however the same issues from the past persist. If skype wishes to compete with other upcoming services
column6: they really need to begin listening to their user base and not shunning them.

column1: Review date: 26th August 2017
Skype version: 7.39.0.102 (most up to date version at the time of this review)"

column1: Skype	1	2015-01-22T17:40:17Z	"I have had been using Skype for a few years as a free user
column2: I starting working away from home so I subscribed to a Skype service with a recurring payment. Everything seemed great
column3: then one day I received an email stated my email address had changed
column4: then shortly after I received two emails from PayPal referring to two successful payments to Skype (this was all at the beginning of Oct 2013). I had not changed my email or made the payment so I tried to contact Skype
column5: unfortunately Skype don't have a helpline number
column6: they do have web chat but you need to log in
column7: and at this time my password had also been changed by the person that had taken over my account. So I had to complete an online form
column8: I received a reference and a note stating someone would contact me within 24hours. At this point someone was taking money from my account and Skype wanted me to wait
column9: I contacted PayPal who stated that the payment was automatic so couldn't be stopped
column11: they stopped all payment to PayPal and the payment in process. So the next day I received an email from Skype stating that something with my request was incorrect and I was to follow a link to complete an online form
column12: I selected the link which took me to the same page as I completed the day before
column13: so I completed the form and also emailed Skype contactus address
column14: again the message stated I would receive and email within 24 hours and again the same email back
column15: to complete the online form. I replied to the emails but with no response
column16: this went on until later November. So as I was getting nowhere I started to get fed up
column17: so I tried the forgot password link after a few weeks of trying to change my password
column18: I received a new one. So I could now access my account
column19: when I logged into the account I noticed I was in credit for the two payment
column20: so I tried the web chat to solve the problem but the guy told me to follow a link or try the contactus email
column21: the link was for the online that I completed at the start
column22: but I tried the form again but was still doing something wrong so nobody would help me
column23: so I asked the online chat to help but again the same link. This went on for a bit
column24: then in about March 2014 I received an email stating my account had been taken over so was block to protect me (5 months after I reported it)
column25: I tried to resolve the issue but got fed up
column26: so stopped using Skype. It is now January 2015 and received an email stating my balance is due to expiry
column27: this is to an account that is blocked.

column1: I am not saying don't use Skype because the free service is good but what ever you do don't use any paid service because your money isn't safe. When I had my problems I also posted it on the Skype online community
column2: to my surprise I found that I wasn't alone and many people had lost money
column3: some in the hundreds but Skype aren't interested."

column1: Upon me asking for a refund due to their inability to secure my account
